notesStmt.note: The first inserted leaf is from a Neapolitan Psalter, mid 15th century; the second inserted leaf is from a Netherlandish book of Hours, mid 15th century

On the large miniature of the Virgin in Glory following the Calendar: the artist is Giovanni Pietro Birago, active in Brecia, Milan, and Venice; there may be some repainting in the illumination; the shield contains the Este arms, but this may be a later addition

Boynton, Susan. "From Book to Song: Texts Accompanying the Man of Sorrows in the Fourteenth and Fifteenth Centuries," in New Perspectives on the Man of Sorrows, ed. Catherine R. Puglisi and William L. Barcham. Kalamazoo: Medieval Institute Publications, 2014, pp. 117-143.
De Ricci, Seymour, with the assistance of W. J. Wilson, Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada, vol. 2 (New York,: H. W. Wilson, 1935-40), p. 2042, no. 103.

Free Library of Philadelphia, A Descriptive Catalogue of the John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts in the Free Library of Philadelphia, compiled by Edwin Wolf, 2nd, with an introduction by Dr. A.S.W. Rosenbach (Philadelphia: The Free Library, 1937), p. 133-134, no. 119.

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This is a 15th century Book of Hours, Use of Rome.

msItem.title: Book of Hours, use of Rome; Litany and Prayers
Leaf from a Book of Hours, mid fifteenth-century
The Seven Joys of the Virgin
Prayers to Mary and to Christ
Prayers to Mary and the Creator
Leaf from a Book of Hours, fifteenth-century

supportDesc.extent: i+63+i; 246 x 168 mm bound to 249 x 182 mm

layoutDesc.layout: Part I: ff. 56; 246 x 168 mm (text: 197 x 130 mm); 1 column of 31 lines, hard point ruling; three additional manuscript leaves inserted into the binding before fol. 1, between fols, 1 and 2 and after fol. 60

decoDesc.decoNote: 1 full-page miniature with full border, 11 historiated initials, illuminated initials throughout, red and blue initials throughout
9rMiniature, Mary floating above a landscape with a mandorla of angels
16vHistoriated initial D, Christ bearing the Cross
17vHistoriated initial D, Saint John the Baptist
43vPrayer to the Virgin, "Te Matrem dei Laudamus"
Insert iii rectoIlluminated initial O, with partial floral border

binding.p: 19th-century red velvet, with gilt and gauffered edges

history.provenance: Este family?; Thomas F. Richardson, Boston; John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia (obtained 1919); given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936; On the recto of the front fly leaf, in pencil "T. F. Richardson" and, in the hand of Lewis, "Officium/Latin ms XV Siecle/(1460) 60 ff./1 full page min/10 smaller ones/Italian"; On fol. 1r, Richardson's stamp and Lewis signature, dated 1919' "22351" written in pencil on the bottom of the back pastedown; Este coat of arms appear on fol. 9r
